View Class

Defined in: src/view.js:57
Module: viewy-view

Base implementation of a view controller providing scoped and configurable behavior across all instances of a view component.

Constructor

()

Defined in src/view.js:57

Methods

$

(
  • [selector]
)
JQuery Element

Defined in src/view.js:464

Performs a jQuery selector scoped to the root element of a loaded view.

Parameters:

  • [selector] String optional

    jQuery selector being scoped to the root element.

Returns:

JQuery Element:

Root element of a loaded view if invoked without a parameter, scoped jQuery selection result if invoked with a selector or undefined if the view is not loaded.

addChildView

(
  • newChildView
)
View

Defined in src/view.js:370

Adds a view to the view hierarchy as a direct child. Does not actually load the child view.

Parameters:

  • newChildView View

    Child view to be added.

Returns:

View:

Added child view.

defineAccessors

(
  • [accessors]
)

Defined in src/view.js:166

Helper function for defining accessors.

Parameters:

  • [accessors] Mixed optional

    Object defining {set: and get:} accessors.

extend

(
  • [extension]
)
Function

Defined in src/view.js:90

Helper function that facilitates prototypal inheritance from Views.

Note: Assign a name to the passed in constructor function in order for it to be correctly printed out in console logs.

Parameters:

  • [extension] Mixed optional

    Prototype attributes and methods being added to the view prototype to be inherited from.

Returns:

Function:

Constructor of the extended/inherited view.

Example:

var MyView = View.prototype.extend({
    constructor: function MyView (config) {..},
    viewDidLoad: function () {..},
    myNewFunction: function () {..}
    myNewAttribute: ..
    ...
};

getPathInHierarchy

() String

Defined in src/view.js:687

Provides a human readable string representation of the view path inside the hierarchy represented by container element names starting with the root view.

Returns:

String:

String representation of the view path inside the hierarchy.

Example:

View hierarchy (container element names):
root
|-> a
|   |-> c
|       |-> d
|-> b

console.log(d.getViewHierarchyHumanReadable());
Output: "root/a/c/d"

getViewHierarchyHumanReadable

() String

Defined in src/view.js:665

Provides a human readable string representation of the current state of the child view hierarchy.

Returns:

String:

String representation of the child view hierarchy.

Example:

Output:
"[View&TestView1@root:loaded]
 |--> [View&TestView2@root/a:!loaded]
 |--> [View&TestView3@root/b:!loaded]"

load

() JQuery Deferred Promise

Defined in src/view.js:487

Loads markup and styles from HTML and CSS files specified by the bundle property into the container element identified by the name property.

Returns:

JQuery Deferred Promise:

Promise for the "view did load" state.

removeAllChildViews

()

Defined in src/view.js:427

Removes all direct child view from the view hierarchy. Unloads child views if necessary.

removeChildView

(
  • childView
)

Defined in src/view.js:398

Removes a direct child view from the view hierarchy. Unloads the child view if necessary.

Parameters:

  • childView View

    Child view to be removed.

removeFromParentView

()

Defined in src/view.js:447

Removes the view from the parent view hierarchy (behaves the same as removeChildView). Unloads the view if necessary.

toString

() String

Defined in src/view.js:630

Provides a human readable string representation of a view.

Returns:

String:

String representation of the view.

Example:

Format: "[<controller/constructor name>&<bundle name>@<path in hierarchy represented by container element names>:<loaded or !loaded>]"
Output: "[View&TestView@root/a/b/c/d:!loaded]"

traverse

(
  • fn
  • level
)

Defined in src/view.js:648

Recursively traverses down the child view hierarchy of a view while invoking a function for each view passing it the view and the recursion level.

Parameters:

  • fn Function

    Function being invoked for each view and being passed the view object and the recursion level.

  • level Number

    Indicates the current level of recursion.

unload

() JQuery Deferred Promise

Defined in src/view.js:587

Unloads the DOM by restoring the originally occupied container element.

Returns:

JQuery Deferred Promise:

Promise for the "view will unload" state.

viewDidLoad

()

Defined in src/view.js:140

Function being called on the view itself when the "view did load" event occurs.

Inherited views may override and implement this function.

viewWillUnload

()

Defined in src/view.js:151

Function being called on the view itself when the "view will unload" event occurs.

Inherited views may override and implement this function.

Properties

_containerElement

JQuery Element private

Defined in src/view.js:348

Backup copy of the original container element to be restored when unloading.

_viewElement

JQuery Element private

Defined in src/view.js:357

Loaded view root DOM node (replacement of the original container element).

bundle

String

Defined in src/view.js:207

HTML & CSS module/filenames.

Default: undefined

childViews

Array of Views

Defined in src/view.js:241

Direct child views down the view hierarchy "owned" by the view.

Setter does not actually load child views.

Default: []

isLoaded

Boolean

Defined in src/view.js:280

Determines whether the view's DOM is currently loaded. This is a purely calculated property.

isRootView

Boolean

Defined in src/view.js:269

Determines whether the view is the first view in a view hierarchy and therefore has no parent view. This is a purely calculated property.

name

String

Defined in src/view.js:192

Unique name for the view to be distinguished from other views at the same hierarchy level.

Default: undefined

onViewDidLoad

Mixed

Defined in src/view.js:296

Subscription for "view did load" events.

Default: { subscribe: Function unsubscribe: Function }

onViewWillUnload

Mixed

Defined in src/view.js:320

Subscription for "view will unload" events.

Default: { subscribe: Function unsubscribe: Function }

parentView

View

Defined in src/view.js:222

Parent view up the view hierarchy that "owns" the view.

Default: undefined
